attributes.action: Allow 17 year olds to vote in future referendums and general elections.
attributes.background: Young people in college are not allowed to vote (if they're under 18) which is extremely unfair as it is our own future. It is ridiculous that those who are 65+ have such a say in our future. Ot is undemocratic that we have no say in our future, and it needs to stop. 17 year olds deserve the vote.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on independence for London
attributes.background: Unlike the rest of the UK, London is predominantly Labour and the whole of London voted to remain in the EU. We are no longer philosophically in step with the rest of the UK. We suggest that London be afforded the opportunity to declare independence, or become part of Scotland, in a referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
London: housing crisis, Muslim Labour mayor, diverse and younger population, voted remain unanimously
Rest of UK: predominantly Conservative, voted for leaving the EU, affordable housing still exists

attributes.action: Don't scrap A level/GCSE Electronics/Systems and control. Help future engineers.
attributes.background: Scrapping these subjects will cause a fall in the amount of students leaving school with any design or electronics experience or knowledge. We should be encouraging students to become enginneers to continue advancements in technology for the future, instead this opportunity is being taken from them.
attributes.additional_details: Gonernment changes to A levels and GCSEs are moving more towards pure academia and although physics and maths are critical in technology and electronics, to be successful in the industry you must still know how to design, how a circuit works, about microchips etc. The things you are not taught in physics. Without these subjects, less people will be inspired to make their own projects and those who are inspired will be ill equipped to do so and will struggle at degree level with no experience.

attributes.action: Mindfulness Meditation on the Curriculum
attributes.background: Add mindfulness meditation to the school curriculum to tackle the issues of stress, anxiety and poor concentration amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details: The Science Behind Mindfulness Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wP9731bDJlE

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Place more stringent requirements on school meals that are served at break.
attributes.background: Currently, at our school, the main meals are healthy, the menu varies and the quality of the produce is high, but as not all of the standards on health, quality and variety apply to break food, the same things are served every day. Fruit is there, but this is expensive and placed in a corner.
attributes.additional_details:
All school health standards should be applied to all meal servings, along with more defined legislation regarding variety and quality, especially for food served at mid-morning break. This will allow students to eat healthier options, eat a varietyâ€‹ of food and know what they are consuming, no matter the time, is of high quality.

Food served at mid-morning break includes:
Pizza slices
Belgian Waffles - which are sprinkled in sugar
Donuts
Paninis
Bacon and cheese rolls - where there is 1cm of fat on each piece of bacon

attributes.action: Contribution to cost of teachers' holidays during Half-term and Summer holidays
attributes.background: Teachers work very hard for little pay. Often they cannot afford the holidays they deserve during their only allocated holiday time, as prices skyrocket during school holidays.
attributes.additional_details: As many people are aware prices to travel abroad or even to enjoy a holiday in the UK skyrocket outside of term time (during school holidays and half term). While parents have the option to take students out of school to avoid such price hikes teachers do not, as it is their duty to teach every single day. I believe teachers should receive a discount or monetary contribution towards holidays during half-term and Summer holidays.

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Make June 15th (signing of the Magna Carta) a bank holiday
attributes.background: Magna Carta is the foundation of our country. It is the beginning of our parliament, the oldest parliament in the world, and the origins of how we view society. So far the only memorial to it was made by the Americans who understand its importance and we should notice the Magna Carta's importance.

attributes.action: Legislate for homeopathic medicines to be tested to provide proof of efficacy.
attributes.background: Under current legislation it is permissible for the manufacturers of homeopathic medicines to sell their products and have them prescribed on the NHS without any proof that they are an effective remedy for any ailment. This has the potential to defraud the purchaser.
attributes.additional_details: Government guidance on the registration of homeopathic medicines. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/register-a-homeopathic-medicine-or-remedy

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 14
attributes.background: Lower the voting age to 14 so that this give a better chance for the young to have a go

attributes.action: MPs and council leaders should cease second occupations until they leave office.
attributes.background: To prevent conflict of interest in the political arena, any person representing the PEOPLE should cease any activities that produce a second income.
attributes.additional_details: When persons are employed by the public purse they should put 100% of their effort into their job. It is known that some tenders for works within the public sector have directly and indirectly benefited State employed individuals. This is morally wrong and adds to the current lack of trust the Public have in our Government and Councils.

attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.background: Include a return to sender address
attributes.additional_details: 16 pages of unsolicited mail requires a return to sender address.

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the worldâ€™s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:

The BBCâ€™s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action: Increase the number of physiotherapists in the NHS.
attributes.background:
Waiting times from a GP referral vary from 2 weeks to 3 months or more.
Prompter physiotherapy would:
1. Increase patient mobility, strength, coordination, confidence and well-being.
2. Prevent deterioration or accidents, thereby reducing treatment costs.
3. Reduce pressure on GPs and hospitals.

attributes.action: Save Violet Melchett Health Centre in Chelsea from Closure
attributes.background: Not only is it for family planning, the fantastic team also specialises in women's health and have helped me personally on numerous occasions with same day appointments, when I wasn't able to get an appointment with my GP. It would be a great loss to the Chelsea community if this centre closes.
attributes.additional_details:
https://community.avaaz.org/petitions/save-the-violet-melchett-health-centre-in-chelsea-1 

Chelsea may soon be losing its last remaining family planning clinic in plans being drawn up by the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) and the NHS, residents and staff have reported. This is despite sexual health diagnoses running at a three year high.

If plans to relocate the Violet Melchett family planning clinic are executed, Chelsea will be left without a dedicated primary family planning clinic.

I have asked them to stop earlier and it has fallen on deaf ears with complete denial. attributes.action: Oppose plans  for responsibility all asylum claims being shifted to the EASO
attributes.background: The FT has brought to our attention plans to make the an EU agency (European Asylum Support Office) responsible for all asylum claims within the EU including the UK, this will mean the UK government will lose control over immigration policy for people arriving from OUTSIDE the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The story was broken by the Financial times on the 7th March and was also featured on Yahoo news:

http://news.yahoo.com/brussels-propose-overhaul-eu-asylum-system-report-001724988.html

Whether you think we should take more or less non EU migrants surely the member states and not the EU should decide it's migration policy not the EU.

I think we should have assurances of the government position on this issue and whether the Prime Minister and leader of the opposition will oppose these changes.

attributes.action: An accused should have the right to total anonymity until a verdict is passed.
attributes.background: The legal assumption that a person is innocent until proven guilty is being degraded by a scandal thirsty media, aided by modern communication technology. An accused should therefore be protected through a legal right to total anonymity until a verdict is passed, in order to receive a fair trial.

attributes.action: Make it law that employees are given a day off in lieu for 29 February.
attributes.background: Regardless of what day of the week 29 February falls on, ultimately every 4 years employees are expected to work an extra day, without additional pay. Employers should give employees an extra day off work in lieu every 4 years.

attributes.action: Re-open the Railway line from Butterley
attributes.background:
I would like the UK Government to consider reopening the former Midland Railway line that ran from Butterley to Derby which also linked up with the Ambergate to Pye Bridge railway line

I believe reopening the section of the line between Butterley and Pye Bridge has huge benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
I think the top authority for the county of Derbyshire, which is Derbyshire County Council should back this petition, because something needs to be done in order to reopen this railway line, and bring back trains to the area!

Trains are needed in this area, in order to reconnect this part of the county that hasn't had a train pass through it in over fifty years!

attributes.action: Make childcare funding available quickly and pay directly to childcare providers
attributes.background: The HMRC can take up to 12 weeks and often longer before they approve funding and pay out to the parents If the HMRC could change their regulations and give child minders guarantee than parents could go back to employment easier and childcare providers would be assured of payment for their services.
attributes.additional_details: As child minders we find ourselves often in the situation where parents build up a back log of fees outstanding because the HMRC haven't approved their funding or stopped it. What do you do in such a situation? We have built up relationships with the child and its parent(s) and its not in the best interest of the child to terminate it. We want the HMRC to speed up the process and pay the child care provider directly to give us security for the hard work we do.

attributes.action: Make disabled spaces legally enforceable and a legal requirement.

Request

I would like two things. Firstly, I would like to see it made a legal requirement for buildings with parking spaces to provide disabled slots.

Secondly, I would like to see it made an offence to park in a disabled space without the appropriate authority - e.g. a blue badge for instance.

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: Keep the UK in the single market and continue to allow free movement of people
attributes.background:
On 23 June 2016 the people of the UK decided that European integration had gone too far.

However we believe that the UK must continue to be part of the single market and continue to allow free movement of people.
attributes.additional_details:
The single market has obviously benefitted the UK economically. Freedom of movement, one of the four freedoms of the single market, is also a basic human right.

Immigration to the UK has had a positive effect on our country. Keeping the borders open means people can continue to work and contribute in this great country and make it even better. And the people of the UK can continue to travel and contribute in the rest of Europe.
